education.thesis: Adaptive fault-tolerant control using reinforcement learning.

experience.title: Graduate Researcher
achievements: Research machine learning algorithms for optimal control using insights from control theory.
Develop reinforcement learning for autonomous drone flight for NASA’s System-wide Safety project by integrating flight and weather data, to quickly adapt flight controller to disturbances.

Design high-fidelity simulations for drones and buildings in python, interfacing with 3D physics engine (Gazebo) in C++, with up to 300% faster than real-time simulation using just-in-time compilation.
Collaborate with stakeholders on campus to learn, deploy, and maintain cloud-based machine-learning controllers in python for energy optimization in smart buildings using BACNet IoT protocol

experience.title: Research Intern
achievements: Drafted patent proposal for distributed, private, and interpretable machine learning-based controllers.
Prototyped a reinforcement-learning framework for distributed energy optimization in smart buildings that can adapt to weather changes by exchanging federated knowledge in neural networks.
Designed an OpenRTB-compatible JavaScript library using TensorFlow.js, for learning how a user interacts with a website, for ad-serving without cross-site tracking.

experience.title: Applied Scientist Intern
achievements: Demonstrated uses of wavelet transforms in machine learning for predictive analytics using vibration signals.
Reviewed prognostics literature, implemented research papers into code, and conducted feasibility studies for project use case by running parallel exploratory experiments on AWS servers.

experience.title: Research Intern
achievements: Studied formation of dark matter in galaxies via high performance computer simulations
Developed point-cloud processing algorithms to fit simulation results against theoretical models of dark matter formation to validate experiment hypotheses
Wrote a parallel data-mining pipeline in python to visualize 3.7TB of n-body simulation results.
Developed visualization tools to generate animated snapshots of dark matter halo evolution.

experience.title: Business Intelligence Intern
achievements: Programmed SQL procedures to consolidate 40 million time-overlapping transactions into 1.5 million records with no data loss.
Rewrote database backup routines to eliminate redundancies and reduced backup sizes by 75%.
Designed visualizations in Domo from Alteryx workflows using sales operations data in North America.

experience.title: Research Intern
experience.workplace: Institute for Space and Defense Electronics, Vanderbilt University
achievements: Researched effects of solar and cosmic radiation on SRAM memory chips in space.
Designed an FPGA interface in VHDL to test memory chips for corruption after irradiation.

skills.title: Programming
skills: Python (PyTorch, Scipy, Django, Matplotlib, Pandas, Sklearn)

extracurriculars.title: Graudate Fellow, Vandirbilt Institute for Digital Learning
description: Explored novel uses of digital media (virtual reality, data visualizations) in pedagogy.
Scripted and produced videos to distil and convey academic research to a broad lay audience.
Curated an online repository of digital learning resources in collaboration with other Fellows.

extracurriculars.title: Resident Advisor
description: Organized after-hours recreational and educational programs for a residential community of 650 students.
Identified students facing academic and personal challenges and provided mentorship, guidance, and connection with on-campus resources.

extracurriculars.title: Mentor and Technical Specialist - Vanderbilt Design Studio
description: Maintained and repaired 3D printers, electronics, and tools at the Design Studio.
Assisted users in design process with Makerbot Desktop and Autodesk 123D Design.

extracurriculars.title: AcFee Subcommittee for Cultural Organizations
description: Reviewed campus organizations’ annual applications for funding.
Allocated $218,000 from university funds to 43 organizations based on annual performance analyses.

extracurriculars.title: Vanderbilt Student Volunteers for Science
description: Taught fundamentals of robotics using LEGO Mindstorms kits to 8th graders in Nashville public schools.
Hosted interactive sessions with high school students about careers in engineering.

publications: Ibrahim Ahmed, Marcos Quiñones-Grueiro, Gautam Biswas. 'A high-fidelity simulation test-bed for fault-tolerant octo-rotor control using reinforcement learning' in DASC 2022
Ibrahim Ahmed, Marcos Quiñones-Grueiro, Gautam Biswas. 'Analysis of the deployment strategies of reinforcement learning controllers for complex dynamic systems' in PHM 2021
Ibrahim Ahmed, Marcos Quiñones-Grueiro, Gautam Biswas. 'Transfer reinforcement learning for fault-tolerant control by re-using optimal policies' in SysTol 2021.
Ibrahim Ahmed, Marcos Quiñones-Grueiro, Gautam Biswas. 'Complementary Meta-Reinforcement Learning for Fault-Adaptive Control' in PHM 2020
Ibrahim Ahmed, Marcos Quiñones-Grueiro, Gautam Biswas. 'Fault-Tolerant Control of Degrading Systems with On-Policy Reinforcement Learning' in IEEE IFAC-PapersOnLine, 2020.
Avisek Naug, Ibrahim Ahmed, Gautam Biswas. 'Online Energy Management in Commercial Buildings using Deep Reinforcement Learning' in IEEE International Conference on Smart Computing, (SMARTCOMP), 2019.
Ibrahim Ahmed, Gautam Biswas, Hamed Khorasghani. 'Comparison of model predictive and reinforcement learning methods for fault tolerant control' in IFAC-PapersOnLine, Warsaw, Poland, 2018.
